reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthening the national response to HIV in order to scale up prevention to comprehensive care, factoring in gender and key population at high risk of HIV infection

description.narrative: Estimates from UNAIDS in 2008 show an average HIV prevalence of 3.9 percent in Côte d'Ivoire which makes it the most affected country in the Western Africa region. Women are disproportionately affected by the epidemic, with a prevalence of 6.4 percent compared to 2.9 percent for men. An extremely high prevalence is also noted in three key populations: Commercial Sex Workers (CSW); Men who have Sex with Men (MSM); and prisoners. The Round 9 proposal further supports the National Strategic Plan for 2006 to 2010 in achieving universal access to prevention, treatment, care and support services. The Program is implemented through the dual-track financing scheme by two Principal Recipients (PR). It aims to prevent new infections, to treat, and to provide care and support for key populations at high risk of HIV infection, and for vulnerable populations through gender-specific intervention. The activities implemented by this PR include behavior change communication, condom distribution, HIV counseling and testing, prevention of mother to child transmission (PMTCT), and care and support for the chronically ill patients.

Coverage / Output indicator for CIV-910-G13-H
Number of civil society organizations (sub recipients) provided with technical support
Number of civil society organizations (sub recipients) supervised during the last quarter
Number of PLWA receiving community based care and support services (by sex and age)

GP-other 1: Number of OVCs receiving community based care and support services (by sex and age) Phase 2 : Number of OVCs receiving community based care and support-defined package of services (by sex and age)

YP-other 1: Number of youth reached with BCC prevention messages through peer educators (by sex and age) Phase 2 : Number of youth 10-24 years old reached with BCC prevention messages through peer educators (by sex and age)
Percentage of MSM that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results

HTS-other 1: Phase1: Number of individuals who received counseling and testing for HIV and received their test result by sex and by age Phase 2 : Number of people who received testing and counseling services for HIV in the community and received their tes

KP-Other 2: Phase 1: Number of commercial sex workers (CSW) reached by HIV/Aids prevention programmes Phase 2: Number and percentatge of commercial sex workers (CSW) reached by HIV/Aids prevention programmes
Number of workers reached at their workplace by peer educator's activities
Number of femal and male condoms distributed for free
KP-Other 3: Number of MSM reached by HIV/AIDS prevention programmes (by age) Phase 2 : Number of MSM reached by HIV/Aids prevention-defined package of services programmes (by age)
TCS-other 1:Number and percentage of adults and children on ART and malnourished receiving nutritional support under the reporting period
PMTCT-other 1: Number of pregnant women sensitized and referred to antenatal clinics offering PMTCT services
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Impact indicator for CIV-910-G13-H
Percentage of young people aged 15–24 who are living with HIV
Estimated percentage of children newly infected with HIV from mother-to-child transmission among women living with HIV delivering in the past 12 months
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Outcome indicator for CIV-910-G13-H
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
% of men reporting the use of condom the last time they had anal sex with a male partner in the last 6 months
% of young women and men aged 15-24 who both correctly identify ways of preventing the sexual transmission oh HIV and who reject the major misconception about HIV transmission
Percentage of female sex workers reporting the use of a condom during penetrative sex with their most recent client
% of women and men aged 15-49 who have had more than one sexual partner in the past 12 months reporting the use of a condom during their last sexual intercourse
